installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "Starting MTA installation..."

# Update and install required packages
apt update -y
apt install -y wget tar ca-certificates

# Change to temp directory
cd /tmp

echo "Downloading MTA server files..."

# Download MTA server (1.6.0+ has native ARM64 support)
wget -q https://linux.mtasa.com/dl/multitheftauto_linux_x64.tar.gz
wget -q https://linux.mtasa.com/dl/baseconfig.tar.gz

echo "Extracting files..."

# Extract archives
tar -xf multitheftauto_linux_x64.tar.gz
tar -xf baseconfig.tar.gz

# Move base config into MTA directory
mv baseconfig/* multitheftauto_linux_x64/mods/deathmatch/
rm -rf baseconfig

# Change to MTA directory
cd multitheftauto_linux_x64

echo "Downloading default resources..."

# Create resources directory and download default resources
mkdir -p mods/deathmatch/resources
cd mods/deathmatch/resources
wget -q https://mirror.mtasa.com/mtasa/resources/mtasa-resources-latest.zip
if command -v unzip >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    apt install -y unzip
fi
unzip -q mtasa-resources-latest.zip
cd ../../..

echo "Cleaning up..."

# Clean up downloaded archives
rm -f /tmp/multitheftauto_linux_x64.tar.gz
rm -f /tmp/baseconfig.tar.gz
rm -f mods/deathmatch/resources/mtasa-resources-latest.zip

echo "Moving files to server directory..."

# Create server directory and move files
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /tmp
mv multitheftauto_linux_x64/* /mnt/server/

# Set permissions
cd /mnt/server
chmod +x mta-server64 2>/dev/null || true
chmod +x mta-server 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Installation complete! MTA server is ready."
echo "Note: MTA 1.6.0+ has native ARM64 support - no emulation needed!"
